forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind 8 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny, with a high near 60. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night embraces Downtown San Francisco, a subtle chance of rain hangs in the air, mingling with the coolness of an evening breeze. The clouds drift above, mostly shrouding the moonlight while a south-southwest wind whispers through the city streets, teasing the edges of light jackets and sweaters. Those venturing out should prepare for a slight dampness, perhaps peering out with an umbrella, just in case the sky delivers on its promise of a sprinkle.

The dawn tomorrow might bring mixed blessings—a high near 60 with a resemblance of sun filtering through the clouds. A 50% chance of rain may yet linger, hinting at the playful interplay between light and shadows overhead. As the day unfolds, the majestic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge may peek through, but be prepared for the presence of fog rolling in from the bay, enveloping the city in a gentle embrace, softening the sharp edges of urban life. Dressing in layers will be wise; a light coat paired with a touch of color might just add to the charm of the day. Consider an afternoon stroll through Golden Gate Park, where the muted greens can be a solace amidst the bustling city, or perhaps a stop at a cozy café where warmth and good company can ward off the chill.
